means: 带来( bring的过去式和过去分词 )
使朝（某方向或按某方式）移动

sentence.Network_en: A journalist all his life, he's now brought out a book.
sentence.Network_cn: 他当了一辈子新闻记者，如今已出了一本书。

sentence.Network_en: Bob died of a heart attack, brought on by his lifestyle.
sentence.Network_cn: 鲍勃死于由他的生活方式引起的心脏病突发。

sentence.Network_en: He once again raised his baton and brought in the brass.
sentence.Network_cn: 他再次举起指挥棒，让铜管乐部加入进来。

entry.def: Brought is the past tense and past participle of bring.

auth_sentence.content: He has brought the same approach to road cycling.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has brought the same approach to road cycling.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has brought the same approach to road cycling.

auth_sentence.content: She's brought the debate back to the people.

Sentence.sentence: But the 1980s brought new competition from Japanese film company Fuji Photo, which undermined Kodak by offering lower prices for film and photo supplies.
She had been brought up on a farm, so the Peace Corps assigned her to an agricultural project.
In the process he brought about great changes in computing, music, telecoms and the news business that were painful for existing firms but welcomed by millions of consumers.
Uncommonly severe droughts brought on by global climate changes have led to forest-eating wildfires from Australia to Indonesia, but nowhere more acutely than in the Amazon.
The man is the only one who brought her book back.
